name: blood
content:
blood noun [U]
(LIQUID)
Add to word list
Add to word list
A2 the red liquid that is sent around the body by the heart, and carries oxygen and important substances to organs and tissue, and removes waste products: lose blood He lost a lot of blood in the accident.dried blood She pointed to a patch of dried blood on the carpet. give/donate blood
to allow a trained person to take some blood from your body so that it can be stored and is ready to be given to people who have lost a lot of blood in an accident or operation: Essentially, giving blood is about saving lives.
See more bloods [ plural ] informal
an informal word for blood tests (= scientific examinations of a person's blood to find out if they have any diseases or lack any important substances): We go around the ward and do routine bloods in the morning. A nurse came in to take his bloods. I went to see the doctor and she ordered some bloods. My bloods came back normal.
More examplesFewer examplesThe teacher drew a diagram showing how the blood flows through the heart.The appeal for people to donate blood was very successful.She lost a lot of blood in the accident.The police found traces of blood on his jacket.The sight of so much blood made him shudder.
